results.title: Area II: Barbara searches the squares
results.brief_description: A girl explores an imaginary place called Arealand where she learns about the use of squares in metric measurment. Demonstrates how to determine area either by counting squares of by multiplying columns by rows. No other credits availabe. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area 1: Barbara arrives in Arealand
results.creator_credit: South Carolina TV Network and Agency for Instructional Television
results.brief_description: In a journey “through her window” Barbara ventures into Arealand for the three programs in the MeasureArea cluster. She explores the concept of area and discovers a variety of ways to determine it with trhe help of many unusual fantasyland characters. In this program Barbara learns that area is two-dimensional and that “covering” is a process to determine area. She encounters square metre, square decimetre and square centimetre. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Are you safe at home?
results.creator_credit: Peter Cock, Crawley Films and George Gorman
results.brief_description: Intelligent methods of preventing fire and of fighting it should it break out. Simple home fire rules are suggested, and types of fire extinguishers suitable for the home are displayed. We see how a family that is well-organised and keeps cool escapes from a burning house and manages to save the building and most of its contents. The graphic story of a man caught in a strange hotel room with both exits barred by flames, shows how even in this desperate predicament knowledge and cool-headedness can avert final disaster. (Award: Chicago)

results.title: Are you ready for sex?
results.creator_credit: Henry Mayer, Mayer Espar Productions and Sheri Gillette Espar
results.brief_description: Through dramatization and student discussions, questions concerning sexual responsibility, inter-personal communication, peer group pressure, sexual maturity, personal values, sexual intercourse, the use of contraceptives and sexual abstinence are examined. The discussion has an American cultural bias. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Are you positive?
results.creator_credit: Ed Cullen, Artransa Park Studios and Eric Porter
results.brief_description: Describes and refutes various common misconceptions about tuberculosis. Shows how erroneous beliefs have arisen and analysis of the mistaken ideas that tuberculosis is no longer a serious disease; that it is easy to control with drugs; that long periods in hospital are not necessary; that it does not affect old people; that people who feel fit cannot be infected. The simple precautions of chest X-ray and skin tests are explained.

results.title: Are you listening?
results.brief_description: Observes the operation of the Development Music Programme, adapted by Deanna Hoermann form the Kodaly method, in New South Wales, where children are being trained to be musically literate. Results show improvements in mathematics, reading, memory, concentration and other learning skills.Classroom activities in kindergarten and primary grades show the techniques and concepts used. Suitable for Upper Secondary and Tertiary students.

results.title: Are you fair dinkum?
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Ben Lewin and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Looks at national identity and how the Australian way of life has been shaped by migration and the response of migrants to it. Shows the changes that have occurred as a result of the contributions of postwar migrants to Australian culture. Considers the role played by politics, the media and education.

results.title: Are You a Racist
results.brief_description: Eight volunteers, either claiming to be racist or victims of racism, spend five days in an isolated house - sharing each other’s company and exploring the issue of racism by talking together about their own feelings and experiences, with some extraordinary and unexpected results.
results.description: Eight volunteers, either claiming to be racist or victims of racism, spend five days in an isolated house - sharing each other’s company and exploring the issue of racism by talking together about their own feelings and experiences, with some extraordinary and unexpected results.

results.title: Are we winning mommy?: America and the cold war
results.creator_credit: Cine Information, Channel 4, ONF | NFB, Sveriges TV and Barbara Margolis
results.brief_description: An award-winning documentary that explores the historical roots of the Cold War and its effects on American life. Featuring historical footage from European and American archives and revealing interviews with key players from both sides, the film traces the Cold War from the end of World War II to the period of Reagan’s Star Wars proposal. It was a war created from ideas, fears and actions of specific people, with real casualties in compromised ideals, economic opportunities and peoples lives. Includes an extensive sampling of Cold War images from Hollywood feature films, TV shows and animated cartoons. Suitable for upper-secondary and tertiary level education.

results.title: Are we really doing well?
results.brief_description: Examines the services provided by the management consultant company Inter-Firm Comparison Service and their different approaches to helping small business proprietors in the areas of efficiency, profitability, flexibility and industrial and public relations. No other credits available.
